19.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.

20.str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

20.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
20.str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
20.str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
A stumbling-block, an occasion for falling, a moral embarrassment. From proskopto; a stub, i.e. occasion of apostasy.

21.str2: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Flesh; plur: pieces of flesh, kinds of flesh. Perhaps a primary word; meat.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

21.str2: From pros and kopto; to strike at, i.e. Surge against; specially, to stub on, i.e. Trip up.

22.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

22.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

23.str2: From dia and krino; to separate thoroughly, i.e. to withdraw from, or oppose; figuratively, to discriminate, or hesitate.
